name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Buffalo Airport

reviews.text: Stayed here back in January and is as expected for a Homewood Suites. With 4 kids my wife and I have stayed at other Homewood suites and buffalo's did not disappoint. Clean and spacious throughout. Good breakfast too. Very comfortable stay and wold stay once again when in the area.
reviews.title: Great for families and cross border shoppers

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at Homewood Suites by Hilton Buffalo Airport for the Amherst AIM Cup Soccer Tournament.
reviews.title: All The Amenities-Solid Hotel Choice

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was "OK". The hot items were average at best but there was plenty of bread products, cereals, fruit, yogurt and juices to make up for it. The hours for this are also a little short in my opinion-ending at 9:00am.
reviews.title: Great hotel for family' s

reviews.text: The suites are very convenient and roomy. The full sized fridge, microwave and stove-top were very helpful and allowed us to reduce costs by being able to cook in our room. The hotel has very convenient highway access and is close to gas stations, Walden Galleria, grocery stores and a variety of fast food locations and restaurants. I would reccomend both Wegmans and Duffs Famous Wings for in-room dining options.
reviews.title: A special weekend with a difficult ending.. with sincere thanks.

reviews.text: The pool and hot tub were clean and a good size.
reviews.title: Fairly average all around

reviews.text: This hotel was by far the cleanest and most comfortable in Buffalo, NY. The rooms were spotless and I felt like I was at home while I stayed here with my family. My two young girls 6 & 4 were comfortable. There was no hotel smell in the room and the hotel reception was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was ok. This hotel was just a little further out then I expected but the closest mall is the Walden Galleria, less than 10 mins away. There was a very nice Wegmans close by. The price was a little high but worth it if you are looking for comfort. I would stay here again!
reviews.title: Very Impressed!!

reviews.text: This hotel has all one expects from a Homewood Suites - large suites, breakfasts, Manager's Reception, clean and well-kept. The location is excellent - about a two-minute drive from BUF and less than 10 minutes to Walden Galleria and the shops around it. We stayed in a two-bedroom suite (1 King, 2 Queens, living area with sofabed), and it was large enough for our family of 7 (2 adults, 5 kids). The pool was good sized (and indoor, which is probaby smart planning for upstate New York). The fitness room is larger than average and well-equipped, with a fair amoutn of strength training equipment, not just a couple of treadmills and an elliptical. THe management and staff were very friendly and helpful, and the hotel has won numerous Hilton awards and accolades (proudly displayed in the breakfast room). The clientele seems to be made up of either people catching one of the early flights out of BUF or Canadians doing some cross-border shopping. My 6-year old has a queston, though, "Why don't they make Lewis the Duck stuffed toys?"
reviews.title: Excellent choice for BUF airport and shopping.

reviews.text: Loved this place! The evening menus are a fun addition! The breakfast was good. The outdoor courtyard is beautiful. Staff are nice! Rooms are spacious and well equipped. Sofabeds need some cleaning and work like new mattress pads, otherwise a great experience,,,
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: If you're looking for a hotel in this area, this has to be the one.
reviews.title: Don't look anywhere else!

reviews.text: I really shopped around to find somewhere nice as I stayed here for 3 weeks, and I couldn't be happier with my choice.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: My son and I used the Homewood Suites in Buffalo as a jumping off point for our NYC trip in APril 2012. It was a great choice. It's a little isolated so I wouldn't recommend it if you were aiming to explore Buffalo itself but it is a great sellection for an overnight before or after a trip to NYC. It is convenient to both the airport and to the Depew Amtrak station. We took the train. ALthough there is no shuttle service the front desk staff were good enough to get us a shuttle from another Hilton hotel when we arrived back from NYC later in the evening. If you are there in time for the included buffet dinner on weekdays it offers pretty good fare. There is a convenience store right across from the hotel and there is a grocery store just about a half a kilometre away. The rooms are roomy and clean. There is a smallish workout facility but it has updated equipment and wasn't busy when we used it. All in all I would recommend this hotel and commend its staff.
reviews.title: Very Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Every Mother's Day my daughter and I go shopping in Buffalo. We book a two room suite at a nice hotel and shop til we drop. We then go back to the hotel, swim use the hot tub and play card or board games in the suite until bed time. The next day we always have breakfast and then hit the shopping malls once again. This past weekend was no different, except we didn't get the chance to stay overnight. We arrived at the hotel around 5:30 pm Saturday, and were told as I had lost my credit card and had to cancel the card, I could not stay in the hotel. I had booked the hotel several months ago and given my credit card info to Hilton reservations. I had cash on me to pay for the room and have always been able to pay cash for a hotel room upon check in last year and the year before we stayed at the Staybridge suites in Buffalo and this was the case, I like this option to pay for the room up front in cash as then I know how much spending money I have left if I decide to go shopping again that night. I offered to give more cash as a down payment as the front desk supervisor advised they need a credit card in case there are any room damages, movie rentals etc. I am a 51 year old woman with a 23 year old daughter. We don't party, trash hotel rooms, steal towels etc. I explained this was my Mother's Day treat and could they not make an exception. The front desk supervisor advised me this was corporate policy which she kept repeating to me, and told me should could lose her job. She then told me she had called the Comfort Suites across the street and they had two rooms left and would take cash. I declined this, as I did not book the Comfort Suites, I don't know anything about the hotel and am very fussy. I liked the reviews I had read online and was looking forward to staying at this hotel. The front desk supervisor then suggested that I could go back home and get my husbands credit card and a permision note to use, I explained this was not an option as I live over 2 1/2 hrs away in Canada. I was then told they would accept a fax copy of his card. This was at almost 6:00 pm on a Saturday night, pretty sure my husband was either still on the golf course or out to dinner with our son as this was his plan. My daughter left very disappointed, finished our shopping and drove back home exhausted, oh and we had to pay duty on everything we bought as we hadn't been away long enough. I believe that good customer service is about bending some rules, looking at who your customer is and making some exceptions, I showed my ID, had my passport I am a Hilton Honours member as well. Long story short, I will not book again through Hilton reservations as no one explained I had to use my credit card to pay for the room, only to hold the reservation. I will not return to this hotel and most likely will pick the Staybridge Suites or a Marriott next time as we have in the past in Buffalo. Too bad, because it looks very nice, but once burned I never change my mind .
reviews.title: Mother's Day Weekend

reviews.text: We stayed at the Homewood in Buffalo in November with my husbad and I and our 2 kids (8 & 10). We wanted a US weekend to do some shopping and hit the Olive Garden.
reviews.title: Perfect stay with or without kids

reviews.text: We booked a standard queen room and when we arrived, there were none left (weird since we had reserved it) but that there was an 'accessible' queen room available so we took that. Being an accessible room, it was a bit larger so it ended up working out.
reviews.title: Worth a stay!
Comfortable stay, near airport
reviews.text: The room had a kitchenette that we barely used (other than the fridge, ice maker and microwave) but was perfect. The 'bedroom' is on it's own in a separate room with the two beds, closet, dresser and flat screen TV. This was awesome since neither the kids or I wanted to watch hockey :) My husband watched hockey in the living room area on the leather sofa and we watched a movie in bed. Perfect set up for families.

Very Nice Hotel. 2 bedroom w/kitchenette suite was very spacious and very well priced. Cozy common room with (free)self-serve beer on tap nice touch to help wind down the evening. Excellent (free) breakfast buffet in the morning - opens early enough so you can grab a bite to eat before your flight. Fast and easy shuttle to a from airport. Maybe next time, we'll stay 2 nights before our flight...
reviews.title: Stay here before your flight

reviews.text: Spacious, clean and relaxing rooms. Very quiet room. All rooms are away from the road for the most part. Staff was a bit bland for hotel staff.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel. They have a really good breakfast. Unlike other hotels where you have to eat in the common area with others, they allow/encourage you to take it to your room. The suite was very spacious and our room was cleaned very well daily. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I really appreciated the layout of the two bedroom suite we stayed in. It is basically a two-bedroom, two-bath apartment fully equipped with living room, dining area, and kitchen. The rooms were clean, the bed comfortable, and the service was good. We didn't eat the breakfast, so I can't comment on that.
reviews.title: Intelligent Design

reviews.text: My only complaint would be that they need to replace the air conditioning unit in the suite we were in. They had obviously been having troubles with it, as we were sent up just a few moments too early (the repairman was still in there). Fortunately, it didn't happen the entire night, but it did have its moments of sounding as if there was a freight train running next to our room. It actually woke me up from a sound sleep at one point. So, whatever was attempted didn't work. I don't think it was a really good idea to know you are having issues with something like this and put customers in the suite, however. I don't believe they were completely booked and surely could have put us in another suite.
reviews.title: Nice, clean hotel with good amenities

aka: Homewood Suites By Hilton Buffalo Airport Hotel Buffalo
